content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's well made :)

Voici pour ceux qui ne comprennent pas le score. C'est expliqué dans la page du jeu quand même.
int penalty = (lturn_combo != -10000) && (turn - lturn_combo) > 10 ? turn*(turn - lturn_combo) : 0; SCORE += 10000 + add_combo - penalty;
i added information for debugging.
Find one dude , friends !!!!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: i upvote 
i reapproved again your puzzle
I don't see any modification with the viewer's options (to help debug)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Reapprove
Revenez les amis !!!!

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)
PLus que 15 heures !!!!!!! aidez moi ce qui sont du niveau au dessus de 20.
amazing )

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: j'accepte cette contribution car je la trouve aboutie et assez complexe pour que l'ont se creuse les méninges mais assez guide pour que des personnes ayants des connaisses légèrement avancer puissent le réussir

I think it makes sense to add `Tavelling salesman problem` tag to this game, because it's close to that problem, but has additional complications. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Travelling_salesman_problem

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cool graphics and easy to understand game mechanics. Getting optimal score looks like a very hard problem
graphics nice !!!!!!
not easy to achieve in python.
Why many people put +1 but didn't approve ? Approve Thanks !!!!

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's fun
Good job
nice

Please explicit that the snake tail increase everytime (if it is the case).
When is the variable "NB_CATCH_IN_2_TURNS_MIN" increased? Before or after calculating the score? When is increased the NB_TURN_WITHOUT_CATCH_RABBIT? What is "turn" in the expression of the penalty? (And why is it not in UPPER CASE ?)
Those informations should go to the "Expert rules" section. In the "Example" section you can give real numbers, it will be more explicit.

Usually, UPPER_CASE variables are more for constants. Please format the variables in the statement.
I updated the map
The map is 54x96, not 45x96 as in the description

The Goal
* Please change "cell" to "cells".

Rules
* Please change "cell" to "cells" (twice).

* Please change "heightxwidth" to "height x width".

Expert Rules
* "... you'll need to know this!": I'll need to know what?

Example
* Please change "do the highest score" to "get the highest score".

* Please change "The score is calculated in adding" to "For each red cell you catch, your score is increased by".

* Please delete "to your score".

Note
* Please fix the typo: "Harcoded": "Hardcoded".

* Please change "highly" to "high".

Game input
* Please delete "The program must first read the initialization data from standard input. Then, provide to the standard output one line with ...".

Input
* Please split the input into two parts: "Initialization input" and "Input for one game turn". You may refer to this example:
https://www.codingame.com/ide/puzzle/search-race

* Please do not format all words in bold. Just format the headings and the line numbers in bold.

* Please change "2 integers" to "2 space-separated integers" (twice).

* Please format "N" as a variable in "N line".

* Please change "N line" to "N lines".

* Please format "NS" as a variable in "NS line".

* Please change "NS line" to "NS lines".

Output
* Please do not format the words in bold.

* Please change "2 integers" to "2 space-separated integers".

Default code
I run the default code and the game has crashed. Please fix the referee code to deal with the situation where a player outputs text instead of integer coordinates.

Thanks.

Tested it with a quick implementation of A*. Really fun, I hope this gets approved. Some grammatical errors and missing information which I believe you will fix in time. It would be nice with at least one static test map for easier debugging.
I added static test and another test random.
I modified
you are from codingame ?
come back
Hello gutty can you approve, it's time ??? Thanks man !!!

Hello, Regis. Some of us would approve it if we could. Just above the Approving/Disapproving tab is a statement from CG:
"MAKE THE CONTRIBUTION PUBLIC (LVL 20+)"

LvL 20+ means that people who aren't at LvL 20 yet, can't approve or disapprove this contribution.

For example, I am at LvL 13... so I can't be a moderator and approve... as much as I'd like to. Some of us are limited by this.

For some of us, the best we can do is upvote or comment.

I hope this answers your question Regis.
Good Contribution, hope someone LvL 20+ approves for you.

Code-Parser.

Hi there FE40536! Could you help by Approving this contribution again? It failed to be approved on time last time.

Thanks, CP.

Hello. Could you approve this contribution again? It seems that it failed to be fully approved... and the process has started over again.

Thanks, CP.
Et comment on fait, il n'y a aucune indication dans le sdk.

I think it's an idea to give an actual numerical example for the scoring (like you have with the snake movement). Eg:
At turn 9 you haven't caught any rabbits, score = ...
Turn 10 still no rabbits, score = ..
Turn 11 you catch one, score = ..
Turn 12 you catch one, score = ..
Turn 13 you catch one, score = ..

Or maybe instead providing pseudo-code for the whole score calc is simpler/clearer. Currently it's particularly unclear how NB_CATCH_IN_2_TURNS_MIN changes.
If you catch a rabbit turn 120 and you catch another rabbit turn 121 , you add a combo otherwise if it's turn 123 no combo added, because it's 3 turn after the turn 120.
I find that . What information do you want for debugging ??? I can adapt
Thank you for your answer. I imagine a screen with more contrast: red for snake, blue for rabbits, for example. It is generally what I do when I create my own vizualizer for a game.
I added debugging info.
It stay 43 min !!!!!

Gutty, please approve.

Cp.
No, a simple CodinGamer who wants to play your game when it is finished :-)
I will modify soon

Yes, but under "rules" it says:
"The game zone works as follows:

    The map of the game is 45x96 size (height x width)"

I personally think the score penalty for using many turns should be larger.
Maybe (10000 - turn) ->  (10000 - turn*5) or (10000 - (turn^2)/50) so its not linear. However if you are happy with how it currently is then I think its fine.

Also at the very bottom it says in plain text:
"
Snake
Play
Play again
"
i updated the scoring system.

Thank you for making the changes.

Expert Rules
* Please change "who" to "which".

* Please change "case" to "cases".

Example
* Please change "red cell" to "rabbit" (twice).

Note
* Please fix the typo: "Hadcoded": "Hardcoded".

Referee code
* Please change "integer" to "integers" (in "You must give space separated integer").

Thanks again.

I modified. 
In the config.ini , there is a word sorting_order . I have to put asc or desc. It's the score of the player in the classement or not ?

Yes, you can get more information here:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/25775/codingame-sdk-documentation/configuration#optimization-game-configuration
It's time for approval !!!

You need to do a little more tweaking! At the moment if an invalid input is given, the game crashes rather than to respond with "Invalid input" and possibly what was passed as input. Just running the starting code triggers this:

The game has crashed. Please contact the author and enclose the following error:

java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "xsnake+1"
	at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:65)
	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:580)
	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:615)
	at com.codingame.game.Referee.gameTurn(Referee.java:176)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.GameManager.start(GameManager.java:122)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.RefereeMain.start(RefereeMain.java:67)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.RefereeMain.main(RefereeMain.java:50)

Perhaps input can be reworded a little bit.

"Input
First turn: Line 1: An integer N for the number of red cells.
N lines containing 2 integers X Y, the coordinates of each red cell.

Subsequent Lines: An integer NS for the number of snake body parts.
NS lines containing 2 integers X Y, the coordinates of the snake body parts.
PS: The first X Y coordinates are those of the snake's head."

You should probably also mention that the snake needs to be always moving. 

Other grammatical fixes I can think of:

Output
Two integers X Y, representing the new coordinates of the snake's head.

Constraints
The allotted response time to output is ≤ 50 ms/turn, within a maximum of 600 turns.

Example
Choose a red cell to capture, pass over it, and attempt to achieve the highest score. The score is calculated by adding (10,000 - turns taken) to your score.

Im not sure the example is actually an example? Also expert rules seems to be lacking the expert rules, if any.

While most of these details are implicitly understood, it's probably important that they're correct for newer coders. You have lots of time though, dont stress!
